metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Compared to display: inline , the major difference is that display: inline-block allows to set a width and height on the element.
content.html: Compared to display: inline, the major difference is that display: inline-block allows to set a width and height on the element.

content.text: Compared to display: block , the major difference is that display: inline-block does not add a line-break after the element, so the element can sit next to other elements.
content.html: Compared to display: block, the major difference is that display: inline-block does not add a line-break after the element, so the element can sit next to other elements.

content.text: The following example shows the different behavior of display: inline , display: inline-block and display: block :
content.html: The following example shows the different behavior of display: inline, display: inline-block and display: block:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
display: 
  inline-block;  width: 100px;  height: 
  100px;  padding: 5px;  border: 1px 
  solid blue;   background-color: yellow;

syntax_highlighting.text:
display: 
  inline-block;  width: 100px;  height: 
  100px;  padding: 5px;  border: 1px 
  solid blue;   background-color: yellow;

content.code_html:
span.a {
  display: inline; /* the default for span */
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  padding: 5px;
  border: 1px solid blue;
  background-color: yellow;
}

span.b {
  display: inline-block;
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  padding: 5px;
  border: 1px solid blue;
  background-color: yellow;
}

span.c {
  display: block;
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  padding: 5px;
  border: 1px solid blue;
  background-color: yellow;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
display: 
  inline-block;  width: 100px;  height: 
  100px;  padding: 5px;  border: 1px 
  solid blue;   background-color: yellow;

content.text: Using inline-block to Create Navigation Links
One common use for display: inline-block is to display list items horizontally instead of vertically. The following example creates horizontal navigation links:
content.html: One common use for display: inline-block is to display list items horizontally instead of vertically. The following example creates horizontal navigation links:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
background-color: yellow;   list-style-type: none;  text-align: 
  center;   padding: 0;  margin: 0;

syntax_highlighting.text:
background-color: yellow;   list-style-type: none;  text-align: 
  center;   padding: 0;  margin: 0;

content.code_html:
.nav {
  background-color: yellow;
  list-style-type: none;
  text-align: center; 
  padding: 0;
  margin: 0;
}

.nav li {
  display: inline-block;
  font-size: 20px;
  padding: 20px;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
background-color: yellow;   list-style-type: none;  text-align: 
  center;   padding: 0;  margin: 0;

content.code_html:
Property Description
display Specifies the display behavior (the type of rendering box) of an element
